intro: Rogeria gayi, commonly known as the yellow rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rogeria gayi is typically found in moist, shaded environments like forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
